turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You see, if a phone's tapped, the Feds can only listen in...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...on the stuff involving crimes. So on...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...routine calls, they have to click off after a few minutes.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Yeah, and I get a sprained fuckin' elbow.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I mean she's only sober about two hours a day. It's usually from eleven in the morning until one in the afternoon. And if I gave her her money and her jewels now, you know what she's gonna do? She's gonna piss it all away in about a year, and then where will she be?  Where would you be then? Comin' right back to me, right back to me.  Or finding some other excuse to come and I - I -

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: We had a deal. Remember that?  He said if it didn't work out between us, that I could get my things and I could leave.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Look in my eyes. Look in my eyes.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Well, that's why I'm here. She wants to come back, but she's afraid you're gonna whack her out.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yeah, they're gonna kidnap my kid. What do you want?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Hi, it's me.  Just who you wanted to talk to, right?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Listen...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...uh-uh-uh - I'm not gonna ask you where you are, just please, put Amy on a plane. Just put her on right away, any plane to get her here right away...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...please. That's all I'm askin' you.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Do you... I mean... I don't think she should go by herself.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: What I mean is, you think if, uh, do you think if I came back... do you think you could forgive me?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Uh,  I don't know. I gotta tell you, I don't know.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I under-understand that. I-I know I fucked up.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: What about the money? Uh, where's the box?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I gotta tell ya...

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: ...I-I... made some mistakes and I spent some money.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: What's it...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...under?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Pretty serious.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: How serious?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: It's, uh, it's under twenty-five.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: It's under...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...twenty-five thousand?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: And...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...the rest of the two million is still there?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Yeah, yeah, I got the rest.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Okay, no big deal. That's okay. Yeah. He got his twenty-five.  That I'll live with. Any more I couldn't.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Okay?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: All right...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: So, what'd ya do with it?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: With what?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: With the money.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: He needed some clothes.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Twenty-five thousand for clothes.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: He wanted a watch, too.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Twenty-five thousand for clothes and a watch.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Mm-hm.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Mm-hm.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: The good part was, I had Amy back. So, we went home, had the housekeeper stay over, put the kid to bed, I calmed myself down and we went to dinner. I tried to keep things nice and civil, you know.  But... hey, twenty-five thousand for three suits? That doesn't make much sense.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: First of all, he's not gonna wear f- thousand-dollar suits. But let's say he did, which he won't. How you gonna get fitted for twenty-five suits in three days?  I, um, I mean, how could you get fitted that fast? I can't get fitted that fast, and I pay twice as much.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I bought him a watch too.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: But even if you bought him a watch, a really nice watch, one that he thought was nice - and he doesn't know what the fuck a good watch is - so, you go, five, ten, twelve grand?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: At the most, which is impossible for him.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Plus, at the most, three suits, a thousand apiece. That still leaves what?  Around ten thousand?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Would you knock it off, Sam?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I'm just tryin' to figure it out.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: There's nothin' to figure out. I'm home... we're workin' it out.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Yes, I want to kill you! I hate your fuckin' guts!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You hate my guts? I want you to come with me now.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Get off of me! Stop it!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Come with me now! Come with me now. Come with me now. I want you out of here.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I want you out of here! I want you out of here!

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Let go of me! Let go of me!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Take your  fuckin' bag and get out of here!

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I'll go, but I want my money right now!

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: The arrangement is over!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: No kidding. NO KIDDING!

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: And I still get my money. I need some cash right now. You can't just put me in the street.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I'll get your cash. You haven't been straight with me ever since I met you! You never loved me in the first place!  I need eyes in the back of my fuckin' head with you, you fuckin' bitch!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You're lower than a dog!

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Fuck you!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Here. Here. Is this enough money?! Huh?  Will it last you two fuckin' days? Take it, greedy bitch.  Take the fuckin' money you fuckin' want.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I'm going to the bank and I'm getting my jewelry too!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yeah, no kidding. Good! It opens at 9 a.m. Be there!

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: And don't send your guys down there to stop me! I mean it.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Stop! You aren't getting rid of me with one fuckin' suitcase!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You'll come back tomorrow and get the rest. Just get out of here.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Fine.  I'm takin' Amy.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You're not takin' Amy.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I am. I'm wakin' her up right now.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You're stoned. You're a junkie. Get out of here.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I am not! She's my daughter too! Goddamn you!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Get out of here!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Hi. You didn't answer your beeper.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I threw it away.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You threw it away?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Look, I tried to do this thing. I know that you want me to, but it's just - You know, I'm driving down the freeway and the fuckin' thing's 'beep-beep-beep-beep'. You know, I'm in a restaurant and it's - it's embarrassing. I don't want to do it anymore.  Where's Amy?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I put her to bed.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Oh.  I got your cigarettes.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Oscar wants you to call him.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: So, who'd you go to lunch with?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: With Jennifer.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: And where'd you go?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: To the Riviera.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: What'd you have?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I had a... salad.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: What did Jennifer have?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: She had the same.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Okay. I want you to call Jennifer and I want you to tell her to tell you what she had for lunch, and I'm gonna listen in on the other line.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Why do you want to do that?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You know why I want to do it. Just do it.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Fine.  Just gonna get the bowl for my thing.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Mm.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: All right... I didn't have lunch with Jennifer.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Who were you with?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I was with somebody.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I know you were with somebody. Who was it?  I just hope it's not someone who I think it might be.  I just hope it's not them.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...she did what she did and I did what I had to do. But, Jesus, Nicky was the worst thing she could've done.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: What if he won't stop?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I mean, it could get us both killed.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I can back him off.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Hi, Sam.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I mean, you tie up our kid and you lock the fuckin' door?  Are...

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Oh...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...you out of your mind? That's our child. Are you out of your fuckin' mind?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: It's just for a little while, Sam. The baby-sitter wasn't there.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I ought to fuckin' have you committed. You fuckin' do that again,  I'll f-, I'll f-

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: She wasn't gonna get up. I was just gonna be out for a little while.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I should have -

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I mean, she was asleep. I was going to be right back before she even woke up.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Listen to me, listen to me, listen to me.  Listen, you fuckin' cunt.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Oh, sh-

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Listen to me.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Fuck you.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Let me tell you something.  Listen to me.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I w- I was gonna be back before she woke up.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You listen carefully! You ever fuckin' touch her again, you ever do anything like that again, I'll fuckin' kill you.  Pure and simple. Do you hear me? Pure and fuckin' simple, I'll fuckin' kill you, you bitch.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Why don't you just let me go, Sam?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You fuckin' whore!

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I'll sign anything you want me to sign, okay?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You understand? What? Let you go?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I just want the key to my jewelry, and I want you to let me go.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You want your jewelry?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I want you to let me go.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: And what? And let you disgrace me, you fuckin' pig? And let you disgrace me?  Get up. Get up and be a mother. Get in the car and go to the house...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Get - Get up! Get up!

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I wou- I wouldn't do that if I were you.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Get - get up!

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I wouldn't do that...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Get up! Get going!  Get up!

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I wouldn't -

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Get the fu-  You threatening me?  I'll fuckin' kill you in this place!  Get up and go home right now.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Now you need approval from him to go home?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: So what? So who fuckin' blew you in the parking lot before you came in... huh?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You make me sick, you fuck. Once a fuckin' hooker, always a hooker.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Oh, fuck you! Fuck you, Sam Rothstein!  Fuck you!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: She, she's alone. Just go. Take the gun and go into Amy's.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: You get down here!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Just wait there for me!

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Get down here and talk to me, goddamn it! Don't fuckin' ignore me! You motherfucker!

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: You come out here and talk to me, you fucker!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Will you stop it? You're drunk, you're on drugs. You're gonna -

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I am not!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You're gonna be sorry if you don't stop that.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Don't you threaten me!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You'll wake the whole neighborhood!

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Don't you threaten me!

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: You are not threatening me anymore!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I'm not -

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I won't let her in. I'm sorry, Randy, I'm not gonna let her in. She - Well, I'm not gonna let her in, the way she's behaving. I'm - I'm -

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Not gonna let me in?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Who knows what you're gonna do in there? I don't want you -

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: What do you mean, what am I gonna do? I'm in the same clothes for two days! I want to get a few of my things! Big deal!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I'm afraid to let her in the house.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Oh, you are...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I'm afraid she's gonna destroy stuff.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Let me in the house! Fucker!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Should I let her in like - ?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: You ought to be afraid, the way you fuckin' treat me!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: If she calms down, I will let her in the house.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I am calm!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: If she calms down...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: After all the threats and all the bullshit, it turned out Ginger didn't tell 'em anything. But by then, the Feds didn't need her, anyway.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: But it was just mine.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: They had all the pieces they needed.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yeah, thanks for not callin' me a liar. You son-of-a-bitch. You son-of- a

turns.speaker: FEMALE NEWSCASTER
turns.text: Good evening, everyone, I'm Paige Novodor.  What should have been a routine licensing hearing turned into bedlam yesterday when the flamboyant Tangiers Casino executive, Sam

turns.speaker: FEMALE NEWSCASTER
turns.text: ...'Ace' Rothstein, accused the state's top gaming officials of corruption.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: What are you running for, Bob? What are you running for?

turns.speaker: FEMALE NEWSCASTER
turns.text: ...and hypocrisy.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Don't you remember? You promised me a fair hearing when you were gettin' comped at my hotel and you were asking me for copies of your bills so -

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: - you could put 'em on your expense account?

turns.speaker: FEMALE NEWSCASTER
turns.text: In a  Wild and unprecedented outburst that followed his gaming license  denial, Rothstein followed several...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Bullshit! Bullshit!

turns.speaker: FEMALE NEWSCASTER
turns.text: ...stunned commissioners into the hallway, where he continued his harangue until his own lawyers and friends urged him to leave.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: We all have a past. You have a past, I have a past. And my past is no worse than yours. But you guys think you have the right to pass judgement on me.

turns.speaker: FEMALE NEWSCASTER
turns.text: Long suspected of running the Tangiers without...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...twenty years in order to find nothin' on me -

turns.speaker: FRANKIE AVALON
turns.text: ...Well, I've got a large family.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: How many kids do you have?

turns.speaker: FRANKIE AVALON
turns.text: Uh, I'm very proud to say that we have eight children.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Eight children!

turns.speaker: FRANKIE AVALON
turns.text: No, no, no, no, please, please, please, please, no, please.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: That's amazing.

turns.speaker: FRANKIE AVALON
turns.text: There was nothing to it.  It was my pleasure.

turns.speaker: WARD
turns.text: It won't happen again, Sam.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Mr Rothstein.

turns.speaker: WARD
turns.text: Loose machines are right back over there.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: What are they doin' way back there? Bring 'em up here where they belong. You can't even see 'em over there.

turns.speaker: WARD
turns.text: Okay, I'll -

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: What about the progressives with the high jackpots? Where are they? These machines are hidden.

turns.speaker: WARD
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: These are our best machines. They bring all the action. No wonder the drop is off.

turns.speaker: WARD
turns.text: Yeah, okay.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: The action is in the front, not in the back. Bring 'em up front.

turns.speaker: WARD
turns.text: All right, I will, I will.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Listen to me very carefully. There are three ways of doing things around here. The right way, the wrong way, and the way I do it. You understand?

turns.speaker: WARD
turns.text: I do understand that. I'll get right on it. And thank you.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Don't thank me, just do it. You're the Slots Manager. I shouldn't have to tell you this.

turns.speaker: WARD
turns.text: Dang, you are right, Mr Rothstein, I am so sorry.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Four reels, sevens across, three fifteen-thousand-dollar jackpots? Do you have any idea what the odds are?

turns.speaker: WARD
turns.text: Shoot, it's gotta be in the millions, maybe more.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Three fuckin' jackpots in twenty minutes? Why didn't you pull the machines? Why didn't you call me?

turns.speaker: WARD
turns.text: Well, it happened so quick. Three guys won. I didn't have a chance to call you.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You didn't see the scam? You didn't see what was goin' on?

turns.speaker: WARD
turns.text: Well, there's no way to determine that, Sam.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yes, there is. An infallible way! They won!

turns.speaker: WARD
turns.text: Well, it's a casino. People gotta win sometimes.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Hey... Ward, you're pissin' me off. Now, you're insulting my intelligence. What do you think, I'm a fuckin' idiot? You know goddamn well somebody had to get into those machines and set those fuckin' reels.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: The probability on one-four-reel machine is a million and a half to one. On three machines in a row, it's in the billions.  It cannot happen... would not happen, you fuckin' momo! What's the matter with you!  Didn't you see you were bein' set up on the second win?

turns.speaker: WARD
turns.text: I really think you're -

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You - Wait! You didn't see that you were being set up on the second win?

turns.speaker: WARD
turns.text: I really think you're overreacting in this whole -

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Listen, you fuckin' yokel, I've had it with you. I've been carryin' your ass in this place ever since I got here. Get your ass and get your things and get out of here.

turns.speaker: WARD
turns.text: You're firin' me?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I'm firin' you? No, I'm not firin'  I'm firin' you, you -

turns.speaker: WARD
turns.text: You might regret this, Mr Rothstein.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I'll regret it even more if I keep you on.

turns.speaker: WARD
turns.text: This is not the way to treat people.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Listen, if you didn't know you're bein' scammed, you're too fuckin' dumb to keep this job. If you did know, you were in on it. Either way, you're out!  Get out! Go on.  Let's go.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...worst possible time for me.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: A record of the arrests...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I had my license hearing coming up and I didn't wanna leave anything to chance.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: That was nineteen years ago, and they were simple gambling pinches.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I mean, if I can't work in Vegas, where am I gonna go?

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: You've been very open with us. I mean, uh, your books and papers and... that - that's gonna mean something when you go before the Commission.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Well, that's all I ask, gentlemen, a fair hearing.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Ah, yes, here we are. A little craps figures.  [Actual amount taken from craps tables before the skim.] Hey - Hey.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Green?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: We had to make an example of these pricks that the party was over.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I'm just curious. I saw you shuffling your checks with your right hand. Can you do that with both hands?

turns.speaker: SIGNALER
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Can't do it with both hands?

turns.speaker: SIGNALER
turns.text: No, Sir.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Can you do it with your left hand?

turns.speaker: SIGNALER
turns.text: Well, I... I never tried.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: So, you're a righty?

turns.speaker: SIGNALER
turns.text: Ye-yeah.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Now, you're gonna have to learn with your left hand.

turns.speaker: SIGNALER
turns.text: God!

turns.speaker: SIGNALER
turns.text: Look what they did to my hand, man!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: All right, I'm gonna give you a choice. You can either have the money and the hammer or you can walk out of here. You can't have both. What do you want?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Excuse me.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Is this yours? Your pen?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Yeah, that's my pen. Why?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I ju- Well, it's a nice pen. I just didn't know whose it was. I thought it was yours. I didn't want it to get lost.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Well, thank you. Why don't you take that fuckin' pen and shove it up you ass, you fuckin' jag-off?

turns.speaker: WINNER
turns.text: I just wanna get out of here.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: And don't forget to tell your friends what happens if they fuck around in here. You understand?

turns.speaker: WINNER
turns.text: I'm sorry. I made a bad mistake.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You're fuckin' right, you made a bad mistake. 'Cause if you come back here - we catch either one of you - we're gonna break your fuckin' heads and you won't walk out of here. You see that fuckin' saw?  We're gonna use it. You don't fuck around in this place. You got it?

turns.speaker: WINNER
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Get out of here.

turns.speaker: WINNER
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: When I left here with the money...

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Mm.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: ...I got muscled on the street.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Mm.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: A couple of guys, I owe them. So, that's what I did. I gave 'em the money.  That's what I did.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You call yourself a man? You know you're a lyin', low-life, motherfuckin' gambling degenerate prick? You know that's what you are? Two small kids at home. I gave you money to pay the fuckin' rent and buy groceries, put the heat on. You know your wife called Frankie and told him the fuckin' heat's off?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: No, no? You didn't?

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: I didn't give 'em the m-

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Don't fuck with me, Al! Don't make a fuck out of me! You want to embarrass me and make a fool out of me?!  You didn't gamble?! Tell me you gambled the fuckin' money, I'll give you the fuckin' money to put the fuckin' heat on! Did you gamble?! Huh?!

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Fuckin' kids at home!  Here.  Get the fuck out of here.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Thanks, Nick.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Yeah, thanks.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Hey... you got a minute? Hey. He's got two million in the box, am I right?  Okay, you let him keep your jewels. We take the cash and the only other thing he cares about.  Huh?  Her majesty. We go to Europe. You dye your hair, get some pl-

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I don't want to go to Europe. I want to go to see The Elephant Man.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: We're not gonna go see any fuckin' elephants, okay?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I don't want to go to Europe.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Shut your mouth!

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: You know where she gets this from!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: You shut up.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: No, you - You want me to come over there? I'll smack your face.

turns.speaker: PISCANO
turns.text: I was out there with my cumma [Italian- American slang for 'girlfriend'.]

turns.speaker: BORELLI
turns.text: Your cumma? What are you doin' with your cumma?

turns.speaker: PISCANO
turns.text: What else? I gave her a schaff [Italian-American slang for 'tap'.]

turns.speaker: BORELLI
turns.text: You gotta go back there and talk to that guy.

turns.speaker: PISCANO
turns.text: Come on, go back there? I never got paid my expenses for the last trip.

turns.speaker: BORELLI
turns.text: What expenses?

turns.speaker: PISCANO
turns.text: Well, I'm goin' all over, layin' money out of my own pocket, and I never get anything back. What the hell's goin' on?

turns.speaker: BORELLI
turns.text: You gotta go back out there.

turns.speaker: PISCANO
turns.text: Well, then, from now on, I'm gonna start keepin' records.

turns.speaker: BORELLI
turns.text: Artie, no records, Artie. What are you gonna do with records? Pay taxes?

turns.speaker: PISCANO
turns.text: Well, I keep layin' out my own fuckin' dough for these trips and nothin' ever comes back. I mean, what hell's goin' on? What are we doin' over here?

turns.speaker: BORELLI
turns.text: You're goin' out to Las Vegas, you're havin' a good time at my expense. What the fuck? I mean, after all, you're the one having a good time, not me.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE CLARK
turns.text: Yeah, that works out.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: But how much cash could I bury in my closet, right?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE CLARK
turns.text: You need to understand, and I - I'm sure you do... that in a venture of this kind, you have to be prepared to take some kind of loss.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Oh, listen, I understand that there's always a risk... you know, I might have to take a loss somewhere.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: So I put some of the money into legitimate deals with Charlie Clark. He was Ace's banker.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I mean, you will try to push it through, won't you, Mr Clark?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE CLARK
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Well, you gotta understand, I'm giving you fifty thousand cash.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: No, I don't want one.  Hey, Mr Clark, how you doin'?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE CLARK
turns.text: Hi. Good.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I've been trying to reach you. You're tougher to get than the President.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE CLARK
turns.text: Well, I've been busy.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Yeah, least you could do is return my phone calls, though.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE CLARK
turns.text: Listen... Nicky... we talked about this... and, uh, I explained to you that there was the possibility you might have to take some kind of loss.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Yeah.  I think I want my money back.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE CLARK
turns.text: What're you gonna do? Strong-arm me?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You know... I think that you've gotten the wrong impression about me. I think in all fairness, I should explain to you what it is that I do. For instance, tomorrow morning I'll get up nice and early, take a walk down over to the bank and walk in and see you, and, uh... if you don't have my money for me, I'll crack your fuckin' head wide open in front of everybody in the the bank. And just about the time that I'm comin' out of jail, hopefully, you'll be comin' out of your coma. And guess what?  I'll split your fuckin' head open again. Because I'm fuckin' stupid. I don't give a fuck about jail.  That's my business. That's what I do. And we know what you do, don't we, Charlie? You fuck people out of money and get away with it.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE CLARK
turns.text: You can't talk to me like...

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Hey, you fat Irish prick. You put my fuckin' money to sleep. You go get my money, or I'll put your fuckin' brain to sleep.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE CLARK
turns.text: Sam?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Never mind fuckin' Sam. This is personal.  I'll be there in the morning. You can fuckin' try me, fatso.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Go back inside! This is none of your business!  I don't have to take your shit all the time anymore.

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I'll to the FBI!

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: Mrs Ro- Mrs Rothstein! Okay, shh!

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: He won't...

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: He won't let me in my own house!

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: Mr Rothstein. Mr Rothstein, I'm sorry. We've got some complaints about - about the noise.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I'm just trying to get in my house!

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: I understand.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: He won't let me go in my house!

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Fucker!

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: Please.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Can I go in?

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: That's not a problem, that's not a p-

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Can I go in?

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: Jeff, would you go in with her?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Um, I'm gonna need a bag. If you could just ask the guy for a big bag, okay?

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: Go get a bag, man.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: And here. Here.

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: Lady, I can't. I can't. I ca-

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: No, you can, you can.  You've been so nice to me.

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: I can't.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: You just - Just stop him.

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: Mr Ro- Mr Roth- Mr Rothstein, where you goin' -

turns.speaker: COP #2
turns.text: What do you want? It - It's pitch- black out here. It's tin foil.

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: Pitch-black?! It -

turns.speaker: COP #2
turns.text: It looked like a fuckin' gun!

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: You - You fuckin' moron, I'll be filling out paper work for the next two months because of you and this piece of shit, you...

turns.speaker: COP #2
turns.text: Oh my God, what are we gonna do? I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: ...fuckin' jerk-off.

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: Hey!

turns.speaker: COP #2
turns.text: Hey!

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: All right. Okay, okay.

turns.speaker: COP #2
turns.text: Mr Rothstein, why don't we just let her in the house and get a few of her things?  That way she'll get out of here. This is half her house anyway.

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: Hey, Mr Rothstein, it'll make it a lot easier on everybody here if we just let her in the house.

turns.speaker: COP #2
turns.text: If we let her get a few of her things we'll be out of your hair.

turns.speaker: COP #2
turns.text: Come on. I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: COP #2
turns.text: There's nothing we can do. She had the key.

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: She's on the account. There's nothing we can do.

turns.speaker: SECURITY GUARD #1
turns.text: Sir, you're gonna have to leave. You mind accompanying us outside?

turns.speaker: COWBOY
turns.text: Bullshit, I ain't goin' anywhere with you!

turns.speaker: SECURITY GUARD #1
turns.text: Bullshit, you're out of here, cowboy!

turns.speaker: COWBOY
turns.text: Fuck you! Fuck you!

turns.speaker: SECURITY GUARD #1
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: COWBOY
turns.text: You know who you're fuckin' with?! Huh? Do you?!

turns.speaker: SECURITY GUARD #1
turns.text: Now move along.

turns.speaker: COWBOY
turns.text: You fuckin' faggot! Do you know who you're fuckin' with?

turns.speaker: COWBOY
turns.text: Leave me alone!

turns.speaker: SECURITY GUARD #1
turns.text: Here we go!

turns.speaker: COWBOY
turns.text: You've gotta be kidding me!

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You called my friend a faggot? You tell him to go fuck himself?

turns.speaker: COWBOY
turns.text: Nicky, I did -

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Is that what you did?

turns.speaker: COWBOY
turns.text: I did - I didn't -

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Tell him to go fuck himself? You fuckin' hick!  Fuckin'...

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You took your boots off? You put your feet on the table... you shit- kicking, stinky, horse-manure-smellin' motherfucker you!  You fuck me up over there, I'll stick you in a hole in the fuckin' desert! You understand?  Go over there and apologize.  Go! Get the fuck out of -

turns.speaker: COWBOY
turns.text: Nicky, I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE JOHNSON
turns.text: Beautiful. You got a beautiful swing.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Ace got my son, little Nicky, involved with Little League, and it was great.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE JOHNSON
turns.text: Now, I want you to get out there and get me singles and doubles, okay? 'Cause that's what's gonna win this game.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Turned out to be one of the other coaches was a fuckin'...

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE JOHNSON
turns.text: Now go out there and show your dad what you can do.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: ...metro intelligence cop. But it didn't matter. I mean, it was all about the kids, you know.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE JOHNSON
turns.text: You know, he's gotta realize everything can't be a home run that he does.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Yeah, well, that's exactly what I keep tellin' him, but that's the kind of kid he is ever since he's born.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE JOHNSON
turns.text: It's instinctive, you know.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: He tries to do everything...

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: ...in some legitimate places, like my restaurant.

turns.speaker: DOMINICK
turns.text: Is that the last one?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I had my kid brother, Dominick, run it for me.

turns.speaker: DOMINICK
turns.text: Fuckers!

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Do you see that? Dumb Jew motherfucker. Grew up together and he's actin' like he don't even know me. I know we're supposed to avoid each other, but, you know, there's ways to do things and there's ways not to.

turns.speaker: DOMINICK
turns.text: Yeah. Fuck him.

turns.speaker: DOMINICK
turns.text: Forget about it, Nick. Don't let it bother you.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Why, does it look like it's bothering me? What do I give a fuck?  Fuckin' Oscar too. All the fuckin' money I've given that prick, he don't even look over here. What's his problem?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: He's comin' over.

turns.speaker: DOMINICK
turns.text: Great!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: EDDY
turns.text: We're waiting on Carmine.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yeah, we're lookin' for Carmine.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Carmine left?

turns.speaker: EDDY
turns.text: He's gone?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: He's not here?

turns.speaker: EDDY
turns.text: Carmine's gone.

turns.speaker: EDDY
turns.text: Hey, Nicky, how are you? What are you doin' here?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I'm over here now.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Yeah, I'm over here with him.

turns.speaker: EDDY
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Carmine? He was here before. I saw him. He had a suitcase and everything, and then he left.

turns.speaker: EDDY
turns.text: Carmine left?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I think, you know, maybe he went across the street or somewhere else or somethin'. I don't know.

turns.speaker: EDDY
turns.text: Well, listen, uh... Good luck with the joint, huh?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Oh, thanks, Eddy.

turns.speaker: PISCANO'S WIFE
turns.text: Artie!

turns.speaker: FBI AGENT #10
turns.text: Calm down! Calm down!

turns.speaker: PISCANO'S WIFE
turns.text: No, I won't calm down! He's my husband!

turns.speaker: FBI AGENT #10
turns.text: Stay out of the way!

turns.speaker: PISCANO'S WIFE
turns.text: Artie! Artie!

turns.speaker: FBI AGENT #10
turns.text: We can't help him if -

turns.speaker: FBI AGENT #2
turns.text: We're - we're placing you under arrest for -

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: FBI AGENT #2
turns.text: We're placing you under arrest for aiding and abetting -

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: FBI AGENT #2
turns.text: We're placing you under arrest for aiding and abetting a -

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: But I'm just trying to leave.

turns.speaker: GAGGI
turns.text: Hey, Frankie.

turns.speaker: MARINO
turns.text: How are you?

turns.speaker: GAGGI
turns.text: Fine, fine.

turns.speaker: GAGGI
turns.text: ...I want all the names of all the other people he had with him. And I don't care what you have to do to him to get 'em. You understand?

turns.speaker: MARINO
turns.text: I'll take care of it, Remo.

turns.speaker: GAGGI
turns.text: E mo va! [Italian-American slang for 'Now, go!']

turns.speaker: GAGGI
turns.text: Frankie... they found a guy's head in the desert. Do you know about that?

turns.speaker: MARINO
turns.text: Yeah, I heard, yeah.

turns.speaker: GAGGI
turns.text: Yeah. Everybody's talkin' about it. They're makin' a big deal out of it.

turns.speaker: MARINO
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: GAGGI
turns.text: It's in all the papers.

turns.speaker: MARINO
turns.text: What're you gonna do?

turns.speaker: GAGGI
turns.text: And I mean... that's no good.

turns.speaker: MARINO
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: GAGGI
turns.text: You gotta tell him... to take care of things a little better.

turns.speaker: MARINO
turns.text: I'll tell him, Remo.

turns.speaker: GAGGI
turns.text: Frankie, I want to ask you something.

turns.speaker: GAGGI
turns.text: It's private... but I want you to tell me the truth.

turns.speaker: MARINO
turns.text: Of course, Remo.

turns.speaker: GAGGI
turns.text: I want you to tell me the truth, mind you.

turns.speaker: MARINO
turns.text: I always tell you the truth, Remo.

turns.speaker: GAGGI
turns.text: Frankie... the little guy, he wouldn't be fuckin' the Jew's wife, would he? Because if he is... it's a problem.

turns.speaker: MARINO
turns.text: What could I say? I knew if I gave the wrong answer, I mean, Nicky, Ginger, Ace, all of 'em could've would up gettin' killed.

turns.speaker: MARINO
turns.text: Because there's one thing about these old timers: They don't like any fuckin' around with the other guy's wives. It's bad for business.

turns.speaker: MARINO
turns.text: So, I lied... even though I knew that by lyin' to Gaggi, I could wind up gettin' killed too.

turns.speaker: MARINO
turns.text: No. I ain't see anything like that.

turns.speaker: GAGGI
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: MARINO
turns.text: I'm positive.  Remo... things are very fucked up down there, you know?

turns.speaker: GAGGI
turns.text: Yeah, I know. That's why I'm asking. You see, my main concern is Nicky.

turns.speaker: MARINO
turns.text: Hm.

turns.speaker: GAGGI
turns.text: I want to know... if he's doin' all right. If he's okay.

turns.speaker: MARINO
turns.text: He's good. He's fine.

turns.speaker: GAGGI
turns.text: I'm askin' you, Frankie, to keep an eye on Nicky. Do it for me.

turns.speaker: MARINO
turns.text: No problem.

turns.speaker: GAGGI
turns.text: You see... I wouldn't want to be jeopardizing anything for people who are our friends. You understand?

turns.speaker: MARINO
turns.text: I understand.

turns.speaker: GAGGI
turns.text: Okay.  Frankie, you're a good boy.

turns.speaker: GAGGI
turns.text: You got a round figure on it?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Definitely the most important guy in this room.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: But back then the bosses didn't give a fuck about whether he enjoyed himself of not. To them, he was a cash register. All they had to do was ring the bell and take the money. Especially Remo, who was a fuckin' degenerate gambler who always lost.

turns.speaker: GAGGI
turns.text: Ma che cazzo!
